page.title: 04FRUIT FARMING IN PULBOROUGH
page.content: I live on a fruit farm in Nutbourne.We grow strawberries, raspberries, loganberries, also blackberries, gooseberries, red and white currants. Rhubarb is the easiest crop to grow but apples grow very well too. In summer the farm is open every day from 9am to 6pm for people to pick their fruit.The farm has 11 fields. Most of the summer we are busy, but the busiest time of year of all is the early Autumn. THE GARDEN CENTRE We went to a Garden Centre near our school which is open from 9.00am to 5.30pm every day. They sell many plants and lots of different kinds of composts. Begonias and Busy Lizzies are the best selling type of flowers. Pulborough people are very keen on their gardens.
